bioghist.p: Ezra Townsend Cresson (1838-1926) was an entomologist, specializing in Hymenoptera. After becoming a member of the Academy of Natural Sciences, Cresson joined with James Ridings and George Newman to found the Entomological Society of Philadelphia, in which he held office through 1924. He was one of the first editors of the "Practical Entomologist" and established the "Entomological News." His memoir of Thomas B. Wilson and his history of the American Entomological Society are considered outstanding historical treatises. Cresson's many years of scientific study culminated in his Synopsis of the Hymenoptera of North America.

scopecontent.p: The collection includes manuscripts of Cresson's writings (annotated typescript, and some handwritten) on Ephydridae, or shore flies. There are also pencil and ink anatomical illustrations for articles. The collection also includes four card file boxes that contain bibliographic information on entomological resources (by year, by geography, by species), and membership cards for the American Entomological Society.

accessrestrict.p: The collection is open for research.

relatedmaterial.p: Related material may be found in the following collections: Academy of Natural Sciences of Philadelphia: American Entomological Society records and E.T. Cresson papers (collections 916 and 673).
